result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daja Janae Lee-Bolton appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference.
Defendant is retaining private counsel attorney Michael Plaisted.

This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. . No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Daja Janae Lee-Bolton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Daja Janae Lee-Bolton.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
